revised_title: Correction of de Sitter's Formula for the Line-Element in General Relativity Theory
tldr: Eddington and Clark re-examine the problem of bodies in general relativity theory, focusing on de Sitter's formula for the line-element. They identify an error in de Sitter's calculations and correct it, resulting in a more accurate determination of the mass of a system of particles. This correction aligns with the theory of the equivalent mass of a system of continuous matter developed by Tolman, Whittaker, and others.
